app_metadata.description: RustFS is an open-source, S3-compatible high-performance object storage system supporting migration and coexistence with other S3-compatible platforms such as MinIO and Ceph.
app_metadata.name: rustfs

run_as_context.description: RustFS runs as any non-root user.

app_metadata.title: RustFS

groups.name: User and Group Configuration
groups.description: Configure User and Group for RustFS

attrs.label: Deployment Mode
attrs.description:
The deployment mode for RustFS.</br>
- SNSD (Single Node Single Disk): Requires a single storage volume.</br>
- SNMD (Single Node Multi Disk): Requires storage volumes equal to the configured volume count defined below.</br>
- MNMD (Multi Node Multi Disk): Requires storage volumes equal to the configured volume count defined below and a list of hosts.</br>

attrs.label: Volume Count
attrs.description: The number of storage volumes to use for SNMD deployments.

attrs.label: Volume Count
attrs.description: The number of storage volumes to use for MNMD deployments.

attrs.label: Hosts
attrs.description:
The list of hosts to use for MNMD deployments.</br>
If you want to use 4 hosts, you will need to provide 4 entries.</br>
For example:</br>
- Host 1: https://rustfs1.example.com:30292</br>
- Host 2: https://rustfs2.example.com:30292</br>
- Host 3: https://rustfs3.example.com:30292</br>
- Host 4: https://rustfs4.example.com:30292</br>
Note that all of them must match the volume count defined above.

attrs.label: User ID
attrs.description: The user id that RustFS files will be owned by.

attrs.label: Group ID
attrs.description: The group id that RustFS files will be owned by.

attrs.label: Port Bind Mode
attrs.description:
The port bind mode.</br>
- Publish: The port will be published on the host for external access.</br>
- Expose: The port will be exposed for inter-container communication.</br>
- None: The port will not be exposed or published.</br>
Note: If the Dockerfile defines an EXPOSE directive,
the port will still be exposed for inter-container communication regardless of this setting.

enum.description: Publish port on the host for external access

attrs.label: Host IPs
attrs.description: IPs on the host to bind this port

attrs.label: Port Bind Mode
attrs.description:
The port bind mode.</br>
- Publish: The port will be published on the host for external access.</br>
- Expose: The port will be exposed for inter-container communication.</br>
- None: The port will not be exposed or published.</br>
Note: If the Dockerfile defines an EXPOSE directive,
the port will still be exposed for inter-container communication regardless of this setting.

attrs.label: Host Network
attrs.description: Bind to the host network. It's recommended to keep this disabled.

attrs.label: Data Disks

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.</br>

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.</br>
SMB Share: Is a SMB share that is mounted to as a volume.</br>
NFS Share: Is a NFS share that is mounted to as a volume.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)
SMB/CIFS Share (Mounts a volume to a SMB share)
NFS Share (Mounts a volume to a NFS share)

1.0.13.readme:
RustFS

RustFS is an open-source, S3-compatible high-performance object storage system supporting migration and coexistence with other S3-compatible platforms such as MinIO and Ceph.
